intro: Darlingia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty darlingia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture and often have a reddish tinge. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
